briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study of Reslizumab to Treat Eosinophilic Esophagitis in Subjects Aged 5 to 18 Years
officialTitle: An Efficacy and Safety Study of Reslizumab (CTx55700) in the Treatment of Eosinophilic Esophagitis in Subjects Aged 5 to 18 Years
summary: This trial will study three doses of reslizumab versus placebo in children with eosinophilic esophagitis (EE). The objectives of the trial will be to study the effectiveness of reslizumab in improving the clinical signs and symptoms and reducing esophageal eosinophils as well as assessing the safety profile compared to placebo.

primaryOutcome.measure: Mean Percent Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Peak Esophageal Eosinophil (EE) Levels
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline, End of Treatment (up to 15 weeks [+/- 4 days])
